title: Floquet Chern Vector Topological Insulators in Three Dimensions
authors: Fangyuan Ma, Junrong Feng, Feng Li, Ying Wu, and Di Zhou
abstract:
We theoretically and numerically investigate Chern vector insulators and
topological surface states in a three-dimensional lattice, based on
phase-delayed temporal-periodic interactions within the tight-binding model.
These Floquet interactions break time-reversal symmetry, effectively inducing a
gauge field analogous to magnetic flux. This gauge field results in Chern
numbers in all spatial dimensions, collectively forming the Chern vector. This
vector characterizes the topological phases and signifies the emergence of
robust surface states. Numerically, we observe these states propagating
unidirectionally without backscattering on all open surfaces of the
three-dimensional system. Our work paves the way for breaking time-reversal
symmetry and realizing three-dimensional Chern vector topological insulators
using temporal-periodic Floquet techniques.
